Authors: Maulana F.I., Zamahsari G.K., Purnomo A.
Title: Web design for distance learning indonesian language BIPA
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Economics Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Communication Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maulana, F.I., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Zamahsari, G.K., Faculty of Economics Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Communication Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purnomo, A., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: BIPA (Bahasa Indonesia bagi Penutur Asing) is an Indonesian learning program for Foreign Speakers. Apart from being a medium for learning and conveying various information about Indonesia, BIPA teaching can also introduce Indonesian culture to foreign speakers. From year to year, international speakers who learn Indonesian continue to grow. This was accompanied by an increase in the number of BIPA providers in Indonesia. To support the acceleration of this growth, digital service is needed to make it easier to find native speaker tutors and adjust material according to the needs of foreign speakers. This digital service is a website that can bring international speakers and Indonesian language tutors wherever they are. This website is named BIPALOKA, which is a digital platform that bridges language lovers around the world who want to learn Indonesian from the community of Professional Indonesian tutors. The method used in making the BIPALOKA website is a waterfall model, which in the process is made in stages starting from analysis, planning, implementation, checking, deploying, and ending with maintenance. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Bahasa indonesia; BIPA; BIPALOKA; Native speaker; Website

Authors: Maulana F.I., Prihatmanto A.S., Kim C.S.
Title: Design and implementation the concept of crowdsourcing on a web portal Crime
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 6th International Annual Engineering Seminar, InAES 2016
Affiliations: Dept. of IT Convergence and Application Engineering, Pukyong National University, South Korea; School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Indonesia; Centre of ICT Research, Bandung Institute of Technology, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maulana, F.I., Dept. of IT Convergence and Application Engineering, Pukyong National University, South Korea, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Indonesia; Prihatmanto, A.S., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung Institute of Technology, Indonesia, Centre of ICT Research, Bandung Institute of Technology, Indonesia; Kim, C.S., Dept. of IT Convergence and Application Engineering, Pukyong National University, South Korea
Abstract: Mutual cooperation is a form of active participation of each individual to engage in value-Added or positive to any object, problems or needs of the people around him. Active participation can include information in the form of a report. In addition to active participation to provide the report, the public can also monitor directly related to the security of a location. With advances in information and communication technology at this time, the public can monitor rapid and real time. Indonesia United (IDUN) utilizing virtual community to create a security monitoring system locations nationwide uses the concept of mutual cooperation or crowdsourcing. The society can be provided information about their crime-prone locations using Indonesia United (IDUN) criminal system based website. Users can share information with location-based systems. This system will be use to report any crime where and when it happened. The proposed system will be very useful for users when traveling to unfamiliar areas, where they have little knowledge about the foreign environment. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Crowdsourcing; Google Map; IDUN; LBS; Traveling Areas; Web Portal Crime
